{\n        _messaging.onMessage = _messaging.onMessage.bind(_messaging);\n        _messaging.onTokenRefresh = _messaging.onTokenRefresh.bind(_messaging);\n      }\n    )\n  }\n\n  requestPermission() {\n    this.angularFireMessaging.requestToken.subscribe(\n      (token) =&gt; {\n        console.log(token);\n      },\n      (err) =&gt; {\n        console.error('Unable to get permission to notify.', err);\n      }\n    );\n  }\n\n  receiveMessage() {\n    this.angularFireMessaging.messages.subscribe(\n      (payload) =&gt; {"body":"<p>How to set environment variables in the code so they are available in imported NPM modules?</p>\n<p>A short example:</p>\n<p><code>index.js</code>:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const supportsHyperlinks = require('supports-hyperlinks');\n\nprocess.env.FORCE_HYPERLINK = 1;\nconsole.log(supportsHyperlinks.stdout); // false; process.env.FORCE_HYPERLINK is undefined inside \n</code></pre>\n<p><code>node_modules/supports-hyperlinks/index.js</code>:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>'use strict';\n\nfunction supportsHyperlink(stream) {\n    const {env} = process;\n\n    console.log(env.FORCE_HYPERLINK); // returns false\n\n    if ('FORCE_HYPERLINK' in env) {\n        return !(env.FORCE_HYPERLINK.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; parseInt(env.FORCE_HYPERLINK, 10) === 0);\n    }\n\n    ...\n}\n\nmodule.exports = {\n    supportsHyperlink,\n    stdout: supportsHyperlink(process.stdout),\n    stderr: supportsHyperlink(process.stderr)\n};\n</code></pre>\n<p>It seems that each NPM module has its own <code>process.env</code> object.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":660,"question_id":64927989,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I followed this tutorial on how to use matter.js of codetrain.\nI was wondering how i could put text in the rectangles?\nFor now it doesn't really matter what the the text is just as long as i can put text in them in a certain way.</p>\n<p>This is what my javascript looks like now\ni'm using the matter.js library and p5.js</p>\n<pre><code>var Engine = Matter.Engine,\n  World = Matter.World,\n  Bodies = Matter.Bodies;\n\nvar engine;\nvar world;\nvar boxes = [];\n\nvar ground;\n\n\nfunction setup() {\n    createCanvas(window.innerWidth, window.innerHeight);\n    engine = Engine.create();\n    world = engine.world;\n    Engine.run(engine);\n    var options = {\n      isStatic: true\n    }\n    ground = Bodies.rectangle(200, height, width, 10, options);\n    World.add(world, ground);\n  }\n\n\nfunction Box(x, y, w, h) {\n    this.body = Bodies.rectangle(x, y, w, h);\n    this.w = w;\n    this.h = h;\n    World.add(world, this.body);\n\n    this.show = function(){\n      var pos = this.body.position;\n      var angle = this.body.angle;\n\n      push();\n      translate(pos.x, pos.y);\n      rotate(angle);\n      rectMode(CENTER);\n      strokeWeight(1);\n      stroke(255);\n      fill(0);\n      rect(0, 0, this.w, this.h);\n      pop();\n    }\n  }\n\nfunction mousePressed(){\n  boxes.push(new Box(mouseX, mouseY, 100, 100))\n}\n\n  function draw() {\n    background(0);\n    for (var i = 0; i &lt; boxes.length; i++) {\n      boxes[i].show();\n    }\n  }\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":659,"question_id":64928004,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders &amp;&amp; getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders.length){\n\n    // OH we found user defined orders, so calculation starts with empty response\n    var response = {};\n    var resPointer = 1;// holds current index of final response, where the obj will be pushed\n    var dbArrIndex = 0;// current db arr index that is waiting for its turn, to be pushed\n\n    // loop through all values and keep pushing in final response unless some DB values comes and get pushed first\n    for(var key in utilities){\n\n        if(dbArrIndex &lt; getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders.length){// if db arr is not finished yet, otherwise we are done with db array\n\n            // trying to check if its time for DB values to be pushed, otherwise all of above loop will be pushed\n            var matching = true;\n            while(matching &amp;&amp; dbArrIndex &lt; getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders.length){// loop can also finish db arr, so validating again\n\n                if(getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders[dbArrIndex].order == resPointer){\n                    response[getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders[dbArrIndex].utility] = utilities[getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders[dbArrIndex].utility];resPointer++;\n                    delete utilities[getUtilityUserPreferences.utilityOrders[dbArrIndex].utility];\n                    matching = true;\n\n                    dbArrIndex++;               \n                }\n                else{\n                    matching = false;\n                }\n\n            }\n        }\n        if(utilities[key]){// could be null by upper if\n            response[key] = utilities[key];resPointer++;\n        }\n    }\n}\n//DONE!!!!!\n\nfor(var key in response){\n\n    //console.log(key);\n}\nconsole.log(response);\nreturn response;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":666,"question_id":64927919,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Breakpoints work, but if the media query is being changed dinamicly, the pagination doesnt work correctly. You have to refresh the page.\nI been told, that I should use slider.update() with breakpointchecker. But It doesn't work. Perhaps, I used it not correctly. How should I use swiper.update in this situation? Here is my code below:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>import {swiper} from '../vendor/swiper';\n\nconst breakpointSm = window.matchMedia('(max-width: 767px)');\n\nconst clientsSlider = () =&gt; {\n  const clientsSliderElem = document.querySelectorAll('.clients-slider__list');\n\n  if (!clientsSliderElem) {\n    return;\n  }\n \n  const clientsSliderSettings = {\n    autoheight: false,\n\n    pagination: {\n      el: '.clients-slider__pagination',\n      type: 'bullets',\n      clickable: true,\n    },\n    navigation: {\n      nextEl: '.slider-controls-btn--next',\n      prevEl: '.slider-controls-btn--prev',\n      disabledClass: 'slider-controls-btn--disabled',\n    },\n\n    breakpoints: {\n      1368: {\n        slidesPerView: 4,\n        slidesPerColumn: 2,\n        slidesPerColumnFill: 'row',\n        slidesPerGroup: 4,\n      },\n      1023: {\n        slidesPerView: 3,\n        slidesPerColumn: 2,\n        slidesPerGroup: 3,\n      },\n      768: {\n        slidesPerView: 2,\n        slidesPerColumn: 2,\n        slidesPerGroup: 2,\n      },\n      320: {\n        slidesPerView: 2,\n        slidesPerColumn: 2,\n        pagination: {\n          el: '.clients-slider__pagination',\n          progressbarFillClass: 'clients-slider__progressbar',\n          type: 'progressbar',\n        },\n      },\n    },\n\n \n    slideClass: 'clients-slider__item',\n    slideActiveClass: 'clients-slider__item--active',\n    slideNextClass: 'clients-slider__item--next',\n    slidePrevClass: 'clients-slider__item--prev',\n    slideVisibleClass: 'clients-slider__item--visible',\n    wrapperClass: 'clients-slider__wrap',\n  };\n\n\n  clientsSliderElem.forEach((slider) =&gt; {\n    const mySwiper = new Swiper(slider, clientsSliderSettings);\n\n    const breakpointChecker = () =&gt; {\n      if (breakpointSm.matches) {\n        mySwiper.update();\n      }\n    };\n\n    breakpointSm.addListener(breakpointChecker);\n\n    breakpointChecker();\n  });\n};\n\n\nexport {clientsSlider};</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":675,"question_id":64927759,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm trying to output an ESM module with WebPack 5.  My understanding is that this feature has been added in version 5, and is used by specifying <code>{output: libraryTarget: 'module'}}</code> and <code>{experiments: {outputModule: true}}</code>.</p>\n<p>I believe that what I'm seeing is just a WebPack bug - perhaps related to <code>outputModule</code> still being experimental, but I'm not very well versed in WebPack so could easily have missed something.</p>\n<p>I get an error <code>'return' outside of function</code>.  With the configuration below, this happens when I run <code>npx webpack</code>.  If I change <code>mode</code> to <code>'development'</code>, then it generates a bundle which indeed has a <code>return</code> statement at the end such that attempting to use it generates a similar error at runtime.</p>\n<p><strong>webpack.config.js:</strong></p>\n<pre><code>const path = require('path');\n\nmodule.exports = {\n    entry: &quot;./index.js&quot;,\n    resolve: { extensions: ['.js'] },\n    //using 'production' rather than 'development' catches error earlier.\n    mode: 'production',\n    experiments: {\n        outputModule: true\n    },\n    output: {\n        filename: 'hello.js',\n        libraryTarget: &quot;module&quot;,\n        path: path.resolve(__dirname, 'dist')\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>index.js</strong></p>\n<pre><code>export default function() { return 42; }\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>package.json</strong></p>\n<pre><code>{\n    &quot;name&quot;: &quot;webpackTest&quot;,\n    &quot;version&quot;: &quot;1.0.0&quot;,\n    &quot;description&quot;: &quot;&quot;,\n    &quot;main&quot;: &quot;index.js&quot;,\n    &quot;scripts&quot;: {\n      &quot;webpack&quot;: &quot;webpack&quot;,\n      &quot;test&quot;: &quot;echo \\&quot;Error: no test specified\\&quot; &amp;&amp; exit 1&quot;\n    },\n    &quot;keywords&quot;: [],\n    &quot;author&quot;: &quot;&quot;,\n    &quot;license&quot;: &quot;ISC&quot;,\n    &quot;devDependencies&quot;: {\n      &quot;webpack&quot;: &quot;^5.5.1&quot;,\n      &quot;webpack-cli&quot;: &quot;^4.2.0&quot;\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":676,"question_id":64927708,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{\n        this.setState({ error: true })\n      })\n  }\n\n  followUser = (e) =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault();\n    const userId = this.props.user[0].id\n    const followedId = e.target.value\n    \n    axios.post(`http://localhost:7001/api/users/${userId}/follow/${followedId}`, {\n      userId,\n      followedId,\n      createdAt: new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10),\n      updatedAt: new Date().toISOString().slice(0, 10)\n    })\n    .then(response =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault();\n    const userId = this.props.user[0].id\n    const followedId = e.target.value\n\n    axios.delete(`http://localhost:7001/api/users/${userId}/unfollow/${followedId}`)\n    .then(response =&gt; {"body":"<p>i am building authentication with react, firebase auth and context api.</p>\n<p>signin.js</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useEffect, useState } from 'react';\nimport { Form, Button, Container, Card } from 'react-bootstrap';\nimport { useAuth } from '../contextApi/contextApi';\nimport { Link } from 'react-router-dom';\nimport { useHistory } from 'react-router-dom';\n\nfunction SignIn() {\n  let history = useHistory();\n  const { signIn } = useAuth();\n\n  const emailRef = React.useRef(null);\n  const passwordRef = React.useRef(null);\n\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);\n\n  let handleSubmit = async (e) =&gt; {\n    e.preventDefault();\n    console.log('connected');\n\n    try {\n      setLoading(true);\n      await signIn(emailRef.current.value, passwordRef.current.value);\n      console.log('push');\n      history.push('/dashboard');\n    } catch {\n      alert('handleSubmit went wrong!');\n    }\n    history.push('/dashboard');\n    setLoading(false);\n  };\n\n  return (\n    &lt;div style={{ backgroundColor: '#a9a9a9' }}&gt;\n      &lt;Container\n        className=&quot;signin d-flex align-items-center justify-content-center&quot;\n        style={{\n          minHeight: '100vh',\n        }}\n      &gt;\n        &lt;Card className=&quot;shadow&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;Card.Body&gt;\n            &lt;h2 className=&quot;text-center mb-4&quot;&gt;Sign In&lt;/h2&gt;\n            &lt;Form onSubmit={handleSubmit}&gt;\n              &lt;Form.Group controlId=&quot;formBasicEmail&quot;&gt;\n                &lt;Form.Label&gt;Email address&lt;/Form.Label&gt;\n                &lt;Form.Control\n                  type=&quot;email&quot;\n                  placeholder=&quot;Enter email&quot;\n                  ref={emailRef}\n                  required\n                /&gt;\n                &lt;Form.Text className=&quot;text-muted&quot;&gt;\n                  We'll never share your email with anyone else.\n                &lt;/Form.Text&gt;\n              &lt;/Form.Group&gt;\n\n              &lt;Form.Group controlId=&quot;formBasicPassword&quot;&gt;\n                &lt;Form.Label&gt;Password&lt;/Form.Label&gt;\n                &lt;Form.Control\n                  type=&quot;password&quot;\n                  placeholder=&quot;Password&quot;\n                  ref={passwordRef}\n                  required\n                /&gt;\n              &lt;/Form.Group&gt;\n              &lt;Button variant=&quot;primary&quot; type=&quot;submit&quot; disabled={loading}&gt;\n                Submit\n              &lt;/Button&gt;\n            &lt;/Form&gt;\n            &lt;div className=&quot;w-100 text-center mt-2&quot;&gt;\n              Need an account? &lt;Link to=&quot;/signup&quot;&gt;Sign up&lt;/Link&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;div className=&quot;w-100 text-center mt-2&quot;&gt;\n              Forgot password? &lt;Link to=&quot;/forgotpassword&quot;&gt;Click here&lt;/Link&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n            &lt;div className=&quot;w-100 text-center mt-2&quot;&gt;\n              Back to &lt;Link to=&quot;/&quot;&gt;Home page&lt;/Link&gt;\n            &lt;/div&gt;\n          &lt;/Card.Body&gt;\n        &lt;/Card&gt;\n      &lt;/Container&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n  );\n}\n\nexport default SignIn;\n</code></pre>\n<p>things work well whenever I signin successfully,\nbut if I failed to signin then later on even if I typein correct passwords/email, signin page won't redirect to dashboard page.</p>\n<p>Can anyshed some lights on which part of my code is wrong?</p>\n<p>contextApi.js</p>\n<pre><code>\nimport React, { useContext, useEffect, useState } from 'react';\nimport { auth } from '../firebase';\nimport { useHistory } from 'react-router-dom';\n\nconst ContextApi = React.createContext();\n\nexport function useAuth() {\n  return useContext(ContextApi);\n}\n\nexport const ContextApiProvider = ({ children }) =&gt; {\n  let [currentUser, setCurrentUser] = useState();\n  let [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const unsubscribed = auth.onAuthStateChanged((user) =&gt; {\n      if (user) {\n        setCurrentUser(user);\n        setLoading(false);\n      } else {\n        setCurrentUser(null);\n        setLoading(false);\n        console.log(currentUser);\n      }\n    });\n    return unsubscribed;\n  }, []);\n\n  const signIn = (email, password) =&gt; {\n    auth.signInWithEmailAndPassword(email, password).catch(function (error) {\n      // Handle Errors here.\n      console.log(error);\n\n      let errorCode = error.code;\n      let errorMessage = error.message;\n      if (errorCode === 'auth/wrong-password') {\n        alert('sign in failed! Wrong password.');\n      } else if (!errorMessage) {\n        alert('you are signed in!');\n      } else {\n        alert(`sign in failed! ${errorMessage}`);\n      }\n    });\n  };\n\n  const signUp = (email, password) =&gt; {\n    auth.createUserWithEmailAndPassword(email, password).catch((error) =&gt; {\n      let errorCode = error.code;\n      let errorMessage = error.message;\n      console.log(errorMessage);\n      console.log(error);\n      console.log(errorCode);\n      if (errorCode === 'auth/weak-password') {\n        alert(`signup failed! The password is too weak!`);\n      } else if (!errorMessage) {\n        alert('signed up successfully');\n      } else {\n        alert(`sign up failed! ${errorMessage}`);\n      }\n    });\n  };\n\n  const resetPassword = (email) =&gt; {\n    auth.sendPasswordResetEmail(email).catch((error) =&gt; {\n      let errorCode = error.code;\n      let errorMessage = error.message;\n      if (errorCode === 'auth/invalid-email') {\n        alert('email not found');\n      } else {\n        alert(errorMessage);\n      }\n    });\n  };\n\n  const logout = () =&gt; {\n    return auth.signOut();\n  };\n\n  let value = {\n    signIn,\n    currentUser,\n    signUp,\n    resetPassword,\n    logout,\n  };\n\n  return (\n    &lt;ContextApi.Provider value={value}&gt;\n      {!loading &amp;&amp; children}\n      {/* {children} */}\n    &lt;/ContextApi.Provider&gt;\n  );\n};\n\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":689,"question_id":64927437,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.\n</code></pre>\n<p>I have looked for a solution in Google and SO but my situation is unique and different which I didn't found.</p>\n<p>Here'e the code:</p>\n<p>Parent Component:</p>\n<pre><code>class CompCalc extends Component {\n\n    state = {\n        inputData: {...},\n        userInput: null,\n        loading: false\n    }\n\n    handleFormData = (data) =&gt; {\n        this.setState({\n            userInput: data\n        });\n    }\n\n    loaderHandler = (status) =&gt; {\n        this.setState({\n            loading: status\n        })\n    }\n\n    render() {\n\n        return (\n            &lt;React.Fragment&gt;\n                &lt;InputForm\n                    inputData={formElementsArr}\n                    formData={this.handleFormData} /&gt;\n\n                &lt;Table \n                    loadingHandler={this.loaderHandler}\n                    loaderState={this.state.loading}\n                    userInput={this.state.userInput} /&gt;\n            &lt;/React.Fragment&gt;\n        );\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Child Component</p>\n<pre><code>const Table = ( props ) =&gt; {\n\n    const loaderHandler = (state) =&gt; {\n        props.loadingHandler(state);\n    }\n\n    let initialAmountInput;\n    let interestRateInput;\n    let tdArr = [];\n    let render;\n\n        \n    if( props.userInput ) {\n        loaderHandler(true); {"body":"<p>I do want to create an access token in the backend and need to pass to the front end to connect to the video chat room.</p>\n<p>This is my back-end code</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const twilioAccountSid = process.env.twilioAccountSid;\nconst twilioApiKey = process.env.twilioApiKey;\nconst twilioApiSecret = process.env.twilioApiSecret;\n\nconst room = \"cool room\";\n\napp.post(\"/access-token\", (req, res) =&gt; {\n  try {\n    console.log(\n      \"sid\",\n      twilioAccountSid,\n      \"key\",\n      twilioApiKey,\n      \"secret\",\n      twilioApiSecret\n    );\n    const identity = \"user\";\n\n    // Create Video Grant\n    const videoGrant = new VideoGrant({\n      room,\n    });\n\n    // Create an access token which we will sign and return to the client,\n    // containing the grant we just created\n    const token = new AccessToken(\n      twilioAccountSid,\n      twilioApiKey,\n      twilioApiSecret,\n      { identity: identity }\n    );\n    token.addGrant(videoGrant);\n\n    // Serialize the token to a JWT string\n    console.log(token.toJwt());\n    res.status(200).json(token.toJwt());\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.warn(error);\n    res.sendStatus(500);\n  }\n});</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>For the Twilio account SID I used my dashboard's SID which is starting from <code>AC</code>\nFor the API key I added the friendly name I gave to the API key when I created it.\nAPI secret is that API key's secret id.</p>\n<p>A token is crearted succefully and passed to the front-end.</p>\n<p>This is my front-end code</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const connectRoom = async () =&gt; {\n          console.log(`A remote Participant connected: ${participant}`);\n          participant.tracks.forEach((publication) =&gt; {\n            console.log(\"for each\");\n            if (publication.isSubscribed) {\n              const track = publication.track;\n              document\n                .getElementById(\"remote-media-div\")\n                .appendChild(track.attach());\n            }\n          });\n          participant.on(\"trackSubscribed\", (track) =&gt; {"body":"<p>I'm using .splice() to remove objects from an array of objects containing a timestamp, based on whether the <code>userDates</code> contains either a matching timestamp or a timestamp within a range of 45 minutes before or after the object's timestamp. Essentially removing all objects with overlapping date values with the userDates array date values.</p>\n<p>When you run this code, you'll notice that some of the objects get removed, but others don't.</p>\n<p>JSFiddle: <a href=\"https://jsfiddle.net/jb2t3Lr9/1/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://jsfiddle.net/jb2t3Lr9/1/</a> and code to reproduce the problem:</p>\n<pre><code>let userDates = [&quot;2020-11-20T22:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-20T23:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-21T00:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-21T01:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T02:15:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T03:15:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T01:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T00:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-21T23:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-13T22:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-14T22:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-15T22:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-16T22:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-13T23:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-12-14T23:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-21T20:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T20:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-22T19:00:00.000Z&quot;,&quot;2020-11-21T19:00:00.000Z&quot;];\n\nlet datesToUpdate = [\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-22T20:00:00.000Z' },\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-21T20:00:00.000Z' },\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-21T19:00:00.000Z' },\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-22T19:00:00.000Z' },\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-22T17:30:00.000Z' },\n  { sessionInterval: 50, dateTime: '2020-11-21T17:00:00.000Z' }\n];\n\n\nfunction removeOverlappingDates(userDates, datesToUpdate) {\n  const FIFTEEN_MINUTES = 15 * 60 * 1000; // milliseconds\n  datesToUpdate.forEach((toUpdate, index) =&gt; {\n    userDates.forEach((date) =&gt; {\n      let dateInMS = new Date(&quot;&quot; + date).valueOf();\n      const fifteenBefore = dateInMS - FIFTEEN_MINUTES;\n      const thirtyBefore = dateInMS - FIFTEEN_MINUTES * 2;\n      const fortyFiveBefore = dateInMS - FIFTEEN_MINUTES * 3;\n      const fifteenAfter = dateInMS + FIFTEEN_MINUTES;\n      const thirtyAfter = dateInMS + FIFTEEN_MINUTES * 2;\n      const fortyFiveAfter = dateInMS + FIFTEEN_MINUTES * 3;\n      let toUpdateInMS = new Date(&quot;&quot; + toUpdate.dateTime).valueOf();\n      if (\n        toUpdateInMS == fifteenBefore ||\n        toUpdateInMS == thirtyBefore ||\n        toUpdateInMS == fortyFiveBefore ||\n        toUpdateInMS == fifteenAfter ||\n        toUpdateInMS == thirtyAfter ||\n        toUpdateInMS == fortyFiveAfter ||\n        toUpdateInMS == dateInMS\n      ) {\n        datesToUpdate.splice(index, 1);\n      }\n    });\n  });\n\n  return datesToUpdate;\n}\n\nconsole.log(&quot;datesToUpdate 1&quot;, datesToUpdate);\ndatesToUpdate = removeOverlappingDates(userDates, datesToUpdate);\nconsole.log(&quot;datesToUpdate 2&quot;, datesToUpdate);\n</code></pre>\n<p>What's even stranger to me is that if I just compare to arrays of datetime values against each other (with the same datetime values as the array of objects contains), then everything gets removed properly. {"body":"<p>I'm trying to create a function that returns an array of random integer numbers whose sum is fixed.</p>\n<p>Here is my code:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function arraySum(a) {\n  return a.reduce((a, b) =&gt; a + b, 0)\n}\n\nfunction getRandomIntInclusive(min, max) {\n  const minCeil = Math.ceil(min)\n  const maxFloor = Math.floor(max)\n  return Math.floor(Math.random() * (maxFloor - minCeil + 1)) + minCeil\n}\n\nfunction randomNumbersWithFixedSum(quantity, sum) {\n  const randoms = [...Array(quantity - 1).keys()].map(q =&gt; getRandomIntInclusive(0, sum/quantity))\n  const last = sum - arraySum(randoms)\n  return [...randoms, last]\n}\n\nconsole.log(randomNumbersWithFixedSum(1, 100))\nconsole.log(randomNumbersWithFixedSum(2, 100))\nconsole.log(randomNumbersWithFixedSum(3, 100))\nconsole.log(randomNumbersWithFixedSum(4, 100))\nconsole.log(randomNumbersWithFixedSum(5, 100))</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>It works but it's not exactly what I want. I would like that each number is random in the range <code>[0, sum]</code>.\nIn the <code>randomNumbersWithFixedSum</code> function I forced that the first <code>(quantity-1)</code> numbers are in <code>[0, sum/quantity]</code>, but I don't like.</p>\n<p>How can I create a really random numbers in <code>[0, sum]</code> whose sum is <code>sum</code>?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":724,"question_id":64926513,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I'm trying to create a reusable component, which alters it's behaviour - essentially rendering to either SVG or Canvas. I'm currently trying to do this by wrapping it up in a HoC (however I'm trying to use React hooks) so this is all falling a bit flat on it's face.</p>\n<hr />\n<p><em>Edit with extra info</em></p>\n<p>With the current approach (HoC returning a function) I get the following error:</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>Functions are not valid as a React child. This may happen if you return a Component instead of  from render. Or maybe you meant to call this function rather than return it.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>If I remove the function call within the HoC's:</p>\n<blockquote>\n<p>React.jsx: type is invalid -- expected a string (for built-in components) or a class/function (for composite components) but got: object</p>\n</blockquote>\n<hr />\n<p>I've seen an <a href=\"https://dev.to/gethackteam/from-higher-order-components-hoc-to-react-hooks-2bm9\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">example</a> of converting HoC's to React hooks, but I'm struggling to work out how I might convert this - if it's even possible and wondering if anyone can give me a pointer? I might have tried to architect this the wrong way, as it feels like quite a complex use case.</p>\n<p>So I've these 2 HoC's at the moment which I feel like I need to refactor somehow to use hooks called <code>withSVG</code> and <code>withCanvas</code>. They setup different DOM to be represented and importantly one has a function called <code>renderLoop</code> which needs to be called from the Scatter component below.</p>\n<p>Slightly quirky, is because the <code>Scatter</code> is just business logic now (leveraging dependencies in the useEffect), it doesn't actually need to return any DOM, because it's just manipulating the DOM of the parent HoC. I'm expecting many more components like <code>Scatter</code> in the future however so don't want to move this logic into the HoCs (if they're even the right way of doing this).</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"true\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const duration = 2000;\n\nconst withSVG = ({ width, height, ...props }) =&gt; WrappedComponent =&gt; {\n    const layer = useRef(null);\n\n    return (props) =&gt; (\n        &lt;g width={width} height={height} ref={layer}&gt;\n            &lt;WrappedComponent {...props} layer={layer} /&gt;\n        &lt;/g&gt;\n    );\n};\n\nconst withCanvas = ({ width, height, ...props }) =&gt; WrappedComponent =&gt; {\n    const layer = useRef(null);\n    const canvas = useRef(null);\n    const renderLoop = getRenderLoop(canvas.current, width, height);\n\n    return (props) =&gt; (\n        &lt;React.Fragment&gt;\n            &lt;custom ref={layer}/&gt;\n            &lt;canvas width={width} height={height} ref={canvas}&gt;&lt;/canvas&gt;\n            &lt;WrappedComponent {...props} layer={layer} renderLoop={renderLoop} /&gt;\n        &lt;/React.Fragment&gt;\n    );\n};\n\nconst Scatter = ({ data, layer, renderLoop }) =&gt; {\n    useEffect(() =&gt; {\n        if (!layer.current) { return; }\n\n        // D3 data join\n        const join = d3\n          .select(layer.current)\n          .selectAll(\"circle\")\n          .data(data, d =&gt; d.key);\n\n        // Shrink the circles to 0 size\n        const exit = join.exit()\n            .transition(\"radius\")\n            .duration(duration)\n            .attr(\"r\", 0)\n            .remove();\n\n        const enter = join.enter()\n            .append(\"circle\")\n            .attr(\"cx\", d =&gt; d.x)\n            .attr(\"cy\", d =&gt; d.y)\n            .attr(\"r\", 0)\n            .style(\"fill\", d =&gt; d.color);\n\n        const update = enter\n            .merge(join)\n            .transition(\"radius\")\n            .duration(duration)\n            .attr(\"cx\", d =&gt; d.x)\n            .attr(\"cy\", d =&gt; d.y)\n            .attr(\"r\", 30)\n            .style(\"fill\", d =&gt; d.color);\n            \n        if (renderLoop) {\n            renderLoop(exit, update);\n        }\n\n    }, [layer, data]);\n\n    return null;\n};\n\nconst CanvasScatter = withCanvas(Scatter);\nconst SVGScatter = withSVG(Scatter);\n\n\n\n\n// index.js\nconst width = 400;\nconst height = 400;\n\nconst App = () =&gt; {\n    \n    const [data, setData] = useState([\n        {\n            key: 1,\n            x: 50,\n            y: 50,\n            color: \"red\"\n        },\n        {\n            key: 2,\n            x: 150,\n            y: 150,\n            color: \"blue\"\n        },\n    ]);\n\n    setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n        setData([\n            {\n            key: 1,\n            x: 100,\n            y: 100,\n            color: \"orange\"\n        },\n        {\n            key: 3,\n            x: 150,\n            y: 50,\n            color: \"green\"\n        },\n        ]);\n    }, 3000);\n\n    return (\n        &lt;div&gt;\n            &lt;svg width={width} height={height}&gt;\n                &lt;SVGScatter width={width} height={height} data={data} /&gt;\n            &lt;/svg&gt;\n            &lt;CanvasScatter width={width} height={height} data={data} /&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    );\n\n    // return &lt;div&gt;Hello React,Webpack 4 &amp; Babel 7!&lt;/div&gt;;\n};\n\nReactDOM.render(&lt;App /&gt;, document.querySelector(\"#root\"));</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react/16.6.3/umd/react.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/react-dom/16.6.3/umd/react-dom.production.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/d3/5.7.0/d3.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div id=\"root\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":732,"question_id":64926365,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Other Firebase libraries\n // are not available in the service worker.\n importScripts('https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/8.0.1/firebase-app.js');\n importScripts('https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/8.0.1/firebase-messaging.js');\n // Initialize the Firebase app in the service worker by passing in\n // your app's Firebase config object.\n // https://firebase.google.com/docs/web/setup#config-object\n firebase.initializeApp({\n   apiKey: 'api-key',\n   authDomain: 'project-id.firebaseapp.com',\n   databaseURL: 'https://project-id.firebaseio.com',\n   projectId: 'project-id',\n   storageBucket: 'project-id.appspot.com',\n   messagingSenderId: 'sender-id',\n   appId: 'app-id',\n   measurementId: 'G-measurement-id',\n });\n // Retrieve an instance of Firebase Messaging so that it can handle background\n // messages.\n const messaging = firebase.messaging();\n // [END initialize_firebase_in_sw]\n \n\n\n// If you would like to customize notifications that are received in the\n// background (Web app is closed or not in browser focus) then you should\n// implement this optional method.\n// [START on_background_message]\nmessaging.onBackgroundMessage(function(payload) {\n  console.log('[firebase-messaging-sw.js] Received background message ', payload);\n  // Customize notification here\n  const notificationTitle = 'Background Message Title';\n  const notificationOptions = {\n    body: 'Background Message body.',\n    icon: '/firebase-logo.png'\n  };\n\n  self.registration.showNotification(notificationTitle,\n    notificationOptions);\n});\n// [END on_background_message]\n</code></pre>\n<p>but still not able to get Push Notification when web is closed. so anyone can help. <br/></p>\n<p>Somewhere i read that too, but not get proper example for that\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/4NEvw.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Suggested Help</a></p>\n<p>Thanks</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":734,"question_id":64926328,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

Thank you.</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html&gt;\n    &lt;head&gt;\n        &lt;meta http-equiv=&quot;Content-Type&quot; content=&quot;text/html; charset=utf-8&quot; /&gt;\n        &lt;title&gt;FlyoutZoomView Example&lt;/title&gt;\n\n        &lt;script language=&quot;javascript&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;\n                src=&quot;https://s7d1.scene7.com/s7sdk/3.5/js/s7sdk/utils/Utils.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n\n        &lt;script language=&quot;javascript&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;\n            s7sdk.Util.lib.include('s7sdk.image.FlyoutZoomView');\n            s7sdk.Util.lib.include('s7sdk.common.Container');\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n\n        &lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot; media=&quot;screen&quot;&gt;\n            .s7flyoutzoomview {\n                width: 300px;\n                height:400px;\n                position:relative;\n                border:1px solid #c2c2c2;\n             }\n            .s7flyoutzoomview .s7highlight {\n                opacity:0.2;\n                background-color: #000000;\n             }\n            .s7flyoutzoomview .s7flyoutzoom {\n                width:400px;\n                height:400px;\n                left:305px;\n                top:0px;\n                position:absolute;\n                border:1px solid #c2c2c2;\n             }\n        &lt;/style&gt;\n\n    &lt;/head&gt;\n    &lt;body&gt;\n        &lt;p&gt;Only one image is OK on the page. Another image should not be added, but replace the previous one. How to modify the buildImg() function to achieve that result?\n        &lt;div id=&quot;s7container-wrapper&quot;&gt;\n            &lt;div id=&quot;s7container&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n        \n        &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; language=&quot;JavaScript&quot;&gt;\n            function buildImg(imgpath) {\n                var params, container, flyoutView;\n\n                s7sdk.Util.init();\n\n                params = new s7sdk.ParameterManager();\n\n                function initViewer(){\n                    params.push(&quot;serverurl&quot;, &quot;http://s7d1.scene7.com/is/image&quot;);\n                    params.push(&quot;asset&quot;, imgpath);\n                    \n                    container = new s7sdk.Container(null, params, &quot;s7container&quot;);\n                    flyoutView = new s7sdk.image.FlyoutZoomView(container, params);\n                }\n\n                params.addEventListener(s7sdk.Event.SDK_READY, initViewer, false);\n                params.init();\n            }\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n        &lt;script&gt;\n            function onPageLoadUnfortunatelyItGetsCalledTwice() {\n                for (i=0; i&lt;2; i++) {\n                    buildImg(&quot;demo/bedroom.tif?p=&quot;+i);\n                }\n            }\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n        &lt;script&gt;\n            onPageLoadUnfortunatelyItGetsCalledTwice();\n        &lt;/script&gt;\n    \n        &lt;button onclick=&quot;buildImg('demo/bedroom.tif?p=135')&quot;&gt;Update the image&lt;/button&gt;\n    &lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":737,"question_id":64926276,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>This is all in Prescriptions.js</p>\n<p>I am fetching a bunch of prescription drugs from my api.</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const [drugs, setDrugs] = React.useState([]);\n    \nuseEffect(() =&gt; {\n    fetch('/api/drugs')\n        .then(response =&gt; response.json())\n        .then(json =&gt; setDrugs(json))\n}, [drugs])\n</code></pre>\n<p>After that's done, I want to make a category array based on drug.class and render it down there. If that category already exists, then push the drug into it's category's array, if it doesn't, make a new array based on that category, push the drug into that array, and render it as shown.</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;/Select&gt;\n    &lt;ListSubheader&gt;Category 1&lt;/ListSubheader&gt;\n    &lt;MenuItem value=&quot;valuehere&quot;&gt;Option 1&lt;/MenuItem&gt;\n    &lt;MenuItem value=&quot;valuehere&quot;&gt;Option 2&lt;/MenuItem&gt;\n    &lt;ListSubheader&gt;Category 2&lt;/ListSubheader&gt;\n    &lt;MenuItem value=&quot;valuehere&quot;&gt;Option 3&lt;/MenuItem&gt;\n    &lt;MenuItem value=&quot;valuehere&quot;&gt;Option 4&lt;/MenuItem&gt;\n&lt;/Select&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>I've been trying to get this done for days and I am stuck, would appreciate some help!</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":738,"question_id":64926273,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>This is what I've got so far:</p>\n<pre><code>from django.views.generic import View\nfrom django.views.decorators.csrf import csrf_exempt\n\nclass ConfigurationView(View):\n\n    @csrf_exempt\n    def dispatch(self, *args, **kwargs):\n        return super(ConfigurationView, self).dispatch(*args, **kwargs)\n\n    def get(self, request):\n        ...\n</code></pre>\n<p>However, when I make an ajax get request to this view I am <strong>not able to access the get method</strong></p>\n<pre><code>function getCookie(name) {\n    let cookieValue = null;\n    if (document.cookie &amp;&amp; document.cookie !== '') {\n        const cookies = document.cookie.split(';');\n        for (let i = 0; i &lt; cookies.length; i++) {\n            const cookie = cookies[i].trim();\n            if (cookie.substring(0, name.length + 1) === (name + '=')) {\n                cookieValue = decodeURIComponent(cookie.substring(name.length + 1));\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    return cookieValue;\n}\n\n$.ajax({\n  url: &quot;https://{{ domain }}/configure&quot;,\n  headers: {\n    'X-CSRFToken': getCookie('csrftoken')\n  },\n  crossDomain: true,\n  data: {\n    email: &quot;{{ email }}&quot;,\n  },\n  dataType: &quot;json&quot;\n})\n</code></pre>\n<p>I think I am sending the <code>csrftoken</code> correctly and I shouldn't really need the <code>csrf_exempt</code>, but either way the request gets a redirection to the login page.</p>\n<p>Any help would be highly appreciated.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":739,"question_id":64926242,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

have given in the UI.\nIs it something possible to do like that?\nIn my PDF I cannot copy text or edit a text and the <code>image</code> or PDF it is very small.</p>\n<p>I can add more code or to
